processSteps.title: What happens after you upload your document
processSteps.step1: Your document is securely uploaded to HaqNow.
processSteps.step2: Our system scans the file for viruses and malware to help protect all users.
processSteps.step3: All detectable metadata is removed and a clean PDF copy of your document is created.
processSteps.step4: HaqNow moderators manually review the document (usually within 12‚Äì24 hours).
processSteps.step5: After approval, the document is published and becomes publicly available on HaqNow.

privacy.title: Privacy Features
privacy.subtitle: HaqNow is designed for strong anonymity for whistleblowers. We implement best-practice protections across our infrastructure to minimize tracking and identification risks.
privacy.cardZeroIpDescription: No IP addresses are stored in our database. Your location and identity remain completely anonymous.
privacy.cardAnonymousDescription: Rate limiting uses session tokens instead of IP tracking. Browse and upload without fear.
privacy.cardPrivacyFirstDescription: File uploads are processed without storing any identifying information about the uploader.
privacy.cardCleanServerDescription: System logs are configured to exclude IP addresses and other identifying information.
privacy.openSourceDescription: Don't just trust our promises ‚Äì verify our privacy implementations yourself. Our complete source code is available on GitHub, allowing security researchers, privacy advocates, and journalists to audit our systems.
privacy.infrastructureDescription: Privacy protection at every technical layer:

privacy.layerSecurity: Security Layer: Rate limiting without IP tracking, secure session management

about.title: About HaqNow
about.globalTransparencyDesc: Exposing corruption worldwide through document disclosure
about.humanRightsDesc: Protecting civilians through accountability and transparency
about.antiCorruptionDesc: Fighting systemic corruption through evidence-based exposure
about.missionTitle: Why I Built HaqNow: A Library for the Truth
about.missionIntro: We are living in an era where the truth is becoming impossible to see. Between AI-generated deepfakes, suppressed news, and the systemic silencing of dissent, "reality" has become a commodity owned by the highest bidder.
about.missionRealization: I realized that we cannot simply hope for the truth to come out. We have to build the infrastructure to protect it.
about.missionPurpose: That is why I built HaqNow.
about.missionNotLeakSite: This is not a "Leak Site." It is an Evidence Library. The world does not need more chaos. It needs accountability. Unlike platforms that dump raw data without context, HaqNow is designed to be a permanent, searchable archive. We are not here to destroy institutions; we are here to correct them.
about.missionWhoWeServeDesc: We have built this infrastructure for the four pillars of accountability:
about.missionWhistleblower: The Whistleblower: We provide a secure, anonymous conduit to safe-harbor your evidence.
about.missionJournalist: The Journalist: We provide verified, translated source materials to support your reporting.
about.missionResearcher: The Researcher: We archive history so it cannot be rewritten or deleted.
about.missionLawyer: The Lawyer: We host the documentation required to build legal cases against corruption.
about.missionOathDesc: Transparency should never come at the cost of human safety. We have established a strict Ethical Moderation Policy.
about.missionOathNo: We do not publish private medical records, personal addresses, or data that endangers innocent individuals.
about.missionOathYes: We do publish evidence of corruption, war crimes, and systemic abuse of power.
about.missionPrivacyDesc: I know the risks you take. That is why we utilize a "Zero-Knowledge" Architecture:
about.missionPrivacyNoTracking: No Tracking: We do not use Google Analytics or pixels. We do not want to know who you are.
about.missionPrivacyEthicalAI: Ethical AI: We utilize <link>Thaura AI</link> to translate and organize documents locally. Your uploads are processed securely, ensuring your data is never fed into corporate surveillance models.
about.missionGovernanceDesc: We are transitioning HaqNow into a Registered Nonprofit Organization. This is critical because trust cannot rely on a single individual. By establishing a nonprofit board and governance structure, we ensure that no single person - including myself - has the power to compromise the mission or silence the platform.
about.missionHaqMeaning: The word "Haq" means Truth and Right. It is not something we are given; it is something we must uphold.
about.featureAnonymousDesc: Complete anonymity for whistleblowers and document providers
about.featureOcrDesc: Automatic text extraction and translation from over 60 languages
about.featureSearchDesc: Powerful search across documents from all countries and regions
about.featureSecureDesc: Privacy-centric design with no IP logging or user tracking
about.whyMattersDesc: Corruption costs the global economy trillions of dollars annually and affects billions of people. By providing a secure platform for document disclosure, we enable journalists, researchers, and citizens to hold powerful institutions accountable.
about.getInvolvedDesc: Join the fight against corruption by uploading relevant documents, sharing our platform, or contributing to our open-source codebase on GitHub.
about.missionDesc1: HaqNow emerges from a deep commitment to ending systemic corruption that fuels conflicts, undermines human rights, and perpetuates global inequality. Through the power of transparency and document disclosure, we believe that exposing corruption is one of the most effective ways to protect civilians, end wars, and advance human rights worldwide.
about.missionDesc2: Corruption thrives in darkness, protected by secrecy and enabled by those who profit from inequality and conflict. When corrupt officials, defense contractors, and political elites operate without accountability, the result is often devastating: unnecessary wars, human rights abuses, and the systematic exploitation of vulnerable populations. By creating a secure, anonymous platform for whistleblowers and truth-tellers, HaqNow aims to shine light on these dark practices.
about.missionDesc3: Our work is rooted in the understanding that transparency is not just a democratic ideal‚Äîit's a tool for peace and justice. Every document exposed, every corrupt scheme revealed, and every truth brought to light contributes to a world where accountability replaces impunity, where human rights are protected, and where the powerful can no longer operate with complete disregard for human suffering.
about.featureAnonymousSecureDesc: Advanced encryption and anonymization to protect whistleblowers and sources.
about.featureGlobalAccessDesc: Multi-language support including Arabic, French, German, Russian, Polish, and Turkish.
about.featureOpenArchiveDesc: Searchable database of corruption documents accessible to journalists and researchers.
about.featureFOIDesc: Comprehensive FOI resources to help citizens demand transparency from their governments.
about.fundingBody: This project's hosting is made possible through the generous funding provided by <link>TechForPalestine.org</link>.
about.affiliatesBody: Information about our trusted affiliates and partners will be displayed here. This section is managed by administrators.
about.hostingBody: HaqNow is hosted on Exoscale, a European cloud platform based in Switzerland. Our services run on Exoscale compute, databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL + pgvector), and SOS object storage, with privacy-focused configurations across the stack.
about.learnMoreDocs: Learn more in our GitHub README

foi.title: Freedom of Information Laws
foi.subtitle: Your guide to accessing government information and promoting transparency worldwide
foi.whatIsDesc1: Freedom of Information (FOI) laws give citizens the right to access government documents, records, and data. These laws are fundamental tools for democracy, transparency, and accountability. They allow journalists, researchers, activists, and ordinary citizens to uncover government activities, expose corruption, and hold public officials accountable.
foi.whatIsDesc2: FOI laws typically cover government agencies, departments, and public institutions. They require these bodies to respond to information requests within specified timeframes, though certain exemptions may apply for national security, personal privacy, or commercial confidentiality reasons.
foi.proTip: üí° Pro Tip: FOI requests are powerful tools for uncovering corruption, government misconduct, and holding power accountable. Combined with platforms like HaqNow, they create a comprehensive approach to transparency and anti-corruption work.
foi.wikipediaLink: Wikipedia's comprehensive article on Freedom of Information laws by country
foi.step1Desc: Determine which government body holds the information you need
foi.step2Desc: Make your request clear, specific, and focused to get better results
foi.step3Desc: Use official portals or contact agencies directly through proper channels
foi.step4Desc: Track your request and appeal if necessary to ensure compliance
foi.countries: FOI Laws and Portals by Country
foi.do1: Be specific about dates, departments, and document types
foi.do2: Request information, not opinions or analysis
foi.do4: Be patient but persistent with follow-ups
foi.dont1: Make overly broad or fishing expedition requests
foi.dont2: Request information that clearly falls under exemptions
foi.dont3: Use FOI for personal disputes or harassment
foi.dont4: Expect immediate responses - processing takes time
foi.dont5: Give up after initial rejection without considering appeals
foi.connectionDesc: When FOI requests uncover corruption, HaqNow provides a secure platform to share those documents with the world. Together, they create a comprehensive approach to fighting corruption and promoting transparency.
foi.connectionPoint1: Use FOI to obtain government documents
foi.connectionPoint2: Share important findings anonymously on HaqNow
foi.connectionPoint3: Enable global access to corruption evidence

disclaimer.title: Security and FAQ
disclaimer.subtitle: Important security information and frequently asked questions
disclaimer.corporateWarningText: DO NOT upload documents from your corporate or government computer.
disclaimer.corporateWarningDescription: Corporations use Data Loss Prevention (DLP) and other similar security software that monitor ALL activity, including what is supposed to be encrypted activity, like logging into your personal bank account. Your IT department will be able to see:
disclaimer.corporateWarningItem1: Whether you visited this website from your corporate computer
disclaimer.corporateWarningItem2: If you uploaded a document or not
disclaimer.countryWarningText: In some countries like Saudi Arabia, China, Iran, Qatar, and Bahrain, all internet activities are monitored. You must be extra careful.
disclaimer.countryWarningItem1: Authorities can see that you visited this website, even from a home computer
disclaimer.countryWarningItem2: They may not be able to tell if you uploaded a document (due to encryption)
disclaimer.countryWarningItem3: Consider using additional privacy tools (VPN, Tor) for extra protection
disclaimer.countryWarningItem4: Be aware of local laws regarding document disclosure and whistleblowing
disclaimer.bestPracticesItem1: Use a personal device - Never use work or government computers
disclaimer.bestPracticesItem2: Use a secure network - Avoid public WiFi when possible
disclaimer.bestPracticesItem3: Consider additional privacy tools - VPN, Tor browser for high-risk situations
disclaimer.bestPracticesItem4: Clear browser data - After visiting, clear your browsing history and cookies
disclaimer.bestPracticesItem5: Be aware of your environment - Ensure physical privacy when uploading
disclaimer.privacyCommitmentText: HaqNow is designed to preserve anonymity for document uploads:
disclaimer.privacyCommitmentItem4: No personal information is required or stored
disclaimer.privacyCommitmentNote: However, your own security practices are crucial for maintaining your anonymity.
disclaimer.faqQ1: Is it really safe to upload documents?
disclaimer.faqA1: Yes, if you follow our security guidelines. HaqNow is designed with complete anonymity in mind - we don't store IP addresses, require registration, or log user activity. However, your own security practices are crucial.
disclaimer.faqQ2: Can my government track me if I upload documents?
disclaimer.faqA2: HaqNow cannot be used to identify you, but governments may monitor internet traffic. In high-risk countries, consider using VPN and Tor browser for additional protection. Never use work or government computers.
disclaimer.faqQ3: What if I work for the government or a corporation?
disclaimer.faqA3: NEVER upload from work computers. Corporate and government networks have monitoring software that can detect your activity. Use only personal devices on personal networks. Consider additional privacy tools if you're in a sensitive position.
disclaimer.faqQ4: How do you protect my documents?
disclaimer.faqA4: We automatically strip all metadata from documents, store them securely with encryption, and never associate them with any identifying information. Your documents become completely anonymous once uploaded.
disclaimer.faqQ5: Can I be prosecuted for whistleblowing?
disclaimer.faqA5: Laws vary by country. Some countries have whistleblower protections, others criminalize document disclosure. Research your local laws and consider the risks. We recommend consulting with legal experts familiar with your jurisdiction.
disclaimer.faqQ6: What types of documents should I upload?
disclaimer.faqA6: Upload documents that expose corruption, government misconduct, corporate wrongdoing, or violations of public interest. Avoid uploading documents containing personal information of innocent individuals or classified information that could harm national security.
disclaimer.faqQ7: How can I verify my uploads were successful?
disclaimer.faqA7: After uploading, documents go through an approval process. You can search the site later to see if your documents appear in the public database. We don't provide individual confirmation to maintain anonymity.
disclaimer.faqQ8: What if I need to upload large files?
disclaimer.faqA8: Our system supports large document uploads. If you have extremely large files, consider breaking them into smaller parts or contacting us through secure channels for guidance on bulk uploads.

moderation.title: HaqNow Moderation Best Practices Policy
moderation.section1Content:
HaqNow is a global, privacy-first platform dedicated to collecting, organizing, and publishing documents that expose corruption by governments and organizations. To maintain integrity, legality, and safety, HaqNow uses a structured moderation process designed to ensure that all published materials are legally obtained, legally publishable, and aligned with its mission.

The following best practices guide how the HaqNow moderation team reviews, approves, and manages submitted documents.

Core principles:

‚Ä¢ Legally obtained only: HaqNow will publish only documents that appear to be legally obtained and legal to publish.
‚Ä¢ Protect individuals, not target them: HaqNow exists to hold institutions accountable ‚Äî not private individuals.
‚Ä¢ Privacy-first: HaqNow does not collect identifying information from uploaders and follows strict privacy regulations.
‚Ä¢ Compliance-oriented: HaqNow prioritizes compliance with international laws to avoid legal disputes.
‚Ä¢ Safety over sensationalism: Documents that risk harm, doxxing, or exposure of private individuals will not be published.
moderation.section2Content:
HaqNow welcomes legally obtained, non-classified documents that expose corruption, mismanagement, abuse of power, or unethical practices by governments, corporations, and institutions. Examples include:

‚Ä¢ Financial records
‚Ä¢ Internal memos
‚Ä¢ Corporate communications
‚Ä¢ Public procurement documents
‚Ä¢ Public audit materials
‚Ä¢ Board minutes
‚Ä¢ Whistleblower evidence (if legally obtained)
‚Ä¢ Agreements, contracts, or correspondence between institutions

Allowed formats: PDF, images, documents, spreadsheets, emails, and text files.
moderation.section3Content:
Moderators must ensure that none of the following types of content are approved:

Prohibited Content:

‚Ä¢ Classified government secrets (national security materials, military secrets, intelligence data, classified diplomatic cables).
‚Ä¢ Personal Identifiable Information (PII) not directly tied to institutional wrongdoing.
‚Ä¢ Any data that could be used to dox or endanger private individuals, including:
  - home addresses
  - phone numbers
  - private emails
  - private financial information
  - medical records
‚Ä¢ Content targeting individuals rather than institutions.
‚Ä¢ Illegally obtained materials (e.g., hacked data, stolen private documents).
‚Ä¢ Forgery, manipulated content, or fabricated evidence (to the best of the moderators' ability to assess).
‚Ä¢ Content intended to harass, intimidate, or incite harm.
moderation.section4Content:
HaqNow moderation is conducted by a multidisciplinary team, including:

‚Ä¢ Legal experts
‚Ä¢ Anti-racism & liberation movement experts
‚Ä¢ Technical and cybersecurity experts
‚Ä¢ Data & documents authenticity reviewers
‚Ä¢ Finance Experts

Moderators review documents for:

1. Legality
   ‚Ä¢ Whether the document appears legally acquired.
   ‚Ä¢ Whether publishing it would violate privacy, classification laws, or other regulations.

2. Ethical and safety compliance
   ‚Ä¢ Ensuring individuals are not targeted or harmed.
   ‚Ä¢ Redaction of sensitive personal information when necessary.

3. Institutional relevance
   ‚Ä¢ Confirming that the document relates to institutions, governments, or organizations.

4. Authenticity assessment
   ‚Ä¢ Using context, metadata (if available), and expert review to evaluate credibility.
   ‚Ä¢ While HaqNow cannot guarantee authenticity, it must make a best-effort determination.
moderation.section5Content:
‚Ä¢ HaqNow never requires identifying information from uploaders.
‚Ä¢ HaqNow does not log IP addresses, making uploads anonymous by design.
‚Ä¢ The platform is open source, allowing external experts to verify security and anonymity protections.
‚Ä¢ Moderators do not have access to identifying information because none is collected.

This ensures maximum protection for journalists, whistleblowers, and activists.
moderation.section6Content:
HaqNow strictly follows:

‚Ä¢ DMCA
‚Ä¢ GDPR
‚Ä¢ Other applicable privacy and data protection laws

Takedown Process:

‚Ä¢ All takedown requests can be submitted via the public form at: https://subscribepage.io/haqnow
‚Ä¢ The link is prominently displayed on the HaqNow homepage.
‚Ä¢ All takedown requests will be actioned without dispute to avoid legal escalation.
‚Ä¢ HaqNow does not enter debates, disputes, or legal battles over removals.
‚Ä¢ Documents taken down will be removed from public access promptly and permanently.

Jurisdiction:

‚Ä¢ HaqNow servers are located in Europe, and moderation practices will adhere to European legal standards and data protection regulations.
moderation.section7Content:
If a document raises concerns (ethical, safety, or legal):

1. Moderators must pause publication.
2. Consult relevant experts (legal, safety, technical).
3. If risk cannot be mitigated or legality cannot be confidently established, decline publication.
4. If already published and a legitimate request arises, remove immediately.

HaqNow prioritizes safety, legality, and compliance above exposure or publication pressure.
